intro: Tylostigma filiforme subsp. bursiferum, commonly known as the slender leaf tylostigma, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its delicate, thread-like leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers that typically bloom in the spring. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Its botanical features include a fibrous root system and a slender, branching stem. It is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
